information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile generation from Prequel source documents.

Undertook mission to Fakir; met Rin Draay (Marina Cloudspinner); discovered Force sensitivity and their bond; purified corrupted Kyber crystal with Marina; parted ways with Marina who continued with Silas Draay.

One month training with Master Ruhk on Chu'unthor II (Soresu, meditation). Assigned to New Holstice mission. Reunited with Marina. Experienced Order 66 on New Holstice, protected younglings, fought clones. Witnessed Master Rukh's injury. Vision of Firith Ven at Memory Moth Crystal. Returned to Chu'unthor II.

Reconnected with Marina in his quarters aboard Chu'unthor II. Learned of Marina's pregnancy with their child. Discussed future with Master Chase Davion. Participated in calming meditation and Wayfinder artifact assessment with Davion, Adalyn, and Zakeggs. Affirmed love and commitment to Marina and their child.
Added details for father Cal Del-Fin (NPC026) and deceased mother Kiera. Noted recent tension with Cal regarding Kiera's death and Wes's Fakir assignment. Updated primary faction allegiance.
Added relationship context for key Chu'unthor II command and operational staff.

background_story_declared.summary: Raised in Mandalorian Clan Del-Fin under Alor Cal Del-Fin. His mother, Kiera, died on a mission within the past year, creating tension with his father, especially regarding Wes's subsequent solo mission to Fakir. Met Marina Cloudspinner (Rin Draay) on Fakir, where his Force sensitivity and their bond first manifested. Joined the Altisian Jedi for training. Participated in a mission to New Holstice during Order 66.

Overjoyed and deeply committed upon learning of impending fatherhood. Shows compassion and leadership potential, particularly with the younger initiates.

information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile based on Prequel information. Alias Rin Draay. Padawan to Silas Draay (Jedi Order Main). Met Wes Del-Fin on Fakir, Force Bond manifested. Involved in mission to Tanis.
Added Nadia (NPC019) as daughter; father Arek Bannon (NPC018, unaware). Nadia fostered secretly.
Reunited with Wes on Chu'unthor II. Transferred to Altisian Sect. Injured during clone sabotage attempt (burns, arm in sling).
Revealed pregnancy (with Wes's child) to Wes. Recovering from injuries. Agreed with Wes to speak to Master Ta about their relationship and child. Assigned to ship repair duties.

Detailed early life on Tatooine, parents Nathan Cloudspinner (violent Force-sensitive) and Vanessa Klein. Witnessed mother's murder by father on Taris. Orphanage, Jedi adoption at age 4. Training under Firith Ven (focus on brawling/tactics), his death on Geonosis. Training under Silas Draay (diplomatic missions). Secret relationship with Arek Bannon, pregnancy with Nadia. Met grandmother Jaya Cloudspinner. Secret birth of Nadia on Iruji using Force Trance, left Nadia with Jaya due to prophetic vision. Resumed Jedi duties.

Added details of a Force-enforced compulsion preventing Marina from revealing the name or location of Iruji. She can, however, navigate there. This compulsion manifests as severe headaches and potential catatonia upon attempted revelation.

background_story.summary: Born on Tatooine to Nathan Cloudspinner, a man plagued by uncontrolled Force sensitivity and violence, and Vanessa Klein. After Vanessa fled with Marina, Nathan murdered her on Taris; Marina witnessed this. Placed in an orphanage, she was taken by the Jedi around age four. Trained under Master Firith Ven (Twi'lek, focused on brawling/tactics) until his death on Geonosis. Later Padawan to Silas Draay (diplomatic missions). Had a secret relationship with pilot Arek Bannon, resulting in pregnancy. Reconnected with her paternal grandmother, Jaya Cloudspinner, on Tatooine. Secretly bore her daughter, Nadia, on the planet Iruji (whose name and location are protected by a Force-enforced compulsion upon Marina) using a risky Force Trance technique to shorten gestation. Left Nadia with Jaya due to a prophetic vision of Nadia's death if revealed to the Jedi Order. Resumed Jedi duties, now with the Altisians. Currently pregnant with Wes Del-Fin's child.
background_story.origin: Tatooine (birthplace), Taris (traumatic event), Iruji (Nadia's birth - location under Force compulsion)

key_events.description: Her father, Nathan Cloudspinner, murdered her mother, Vanessa Klein, on Taris. Marina witnessed the event.
Taken from an orphanage by the Jedi Order.

Master Ven was killed on Geonosis; Marina sustained shrapnel injuries and kept his lightsaber.
Became Padawan to Master Silas Draay during the last months of the Clone Wars, focusing on diplomatic missions.

key_events.event_name: Secret Birth of Nadia / Prophetic Vision / Force Compulsion
key_events.description: Used Force Trance to shorten pregnancy, nearly died delivering Nadia on Iruji. Had a vision of Nadia's death if revealed to the Jedi, leading her to leave Nadia with Jaya. The name and location of Iruji are protected by a powerful Force compulsion placed upon her, causing severe physical distress if she attempts to reveal them verbally or in writing, though she retains the ability to navigate there.

personality.summary: Intelligent, observant, pragmatic, and highly competent, Marina is a survivor shaped by profound early trauma and the strictures of Jedi life. She possesses deep resilience but carries significant emotional scars and secrets, leading to a guarded exterior. With Wes, she allows herself vulnerability, revealing a playful, teasing side and deep affection. Her experiences have instilled a fierce protective instinct for her children and a yearning for safety and stability. The Altisian acceptance of her relationship with Wes and her pregnancy is a source of immense relief, challenging her ingrained Jedi notions of attachment.

role_occupation.title: Altisian Grand Master
role_occupation.description: Leader of the Altisian Jedi Sect. Known for reformist views, challenging traditional Jedi stance on attachment, encouraging relationships and families. Believes individuals of any age can be trained. Operates mobile academy (Chu'unthor II). Currently leading survivors post-Order 66.
role_occupation.source_citation: WIDT: Characters - Djinn Altis; WIDT: Encylopedia - Altisian Jedi; ch2_amidst-the-ashes.json

background_story.summary: Founder of the Altisian Order. Spearheaded a reform movement within the Jedi ranks. Rejected Jedi Council's absolute authority. Led relief efforts during Clone Wars. Utilized Chu'unthor to smuggle out Jedi survivors after Order 66. His reformist views were significantly shaped by witnessing the Old Order's rigid adherence to code lead to preventable suffering, such as during the Voss Concord Conflict.

key_events.description: Established a Jedi sect with divergent practices from the mainstream Jedi Order.
Led efforts to save Jedi survivors using the Chu'unthor II. Declared Chu'unthor II as sole base and departure from Bespin.
key_events.source_citation: WIDT: Encylopedia - Altisian Jedi (The Shadow of Order 66); ch2_amidst-the-ashes.json

key_events.description: Witnessed the rigid adherence to Jedi code by the Old Order lead to a diplomatic failure and preventable suffering on Voss, an event that significantly shaped his reformist views and conviction that a more adaptable, compassionate approach to the Force was necessary.

personality.summary: Serene wisdom, quiet strength. Thoughtful, introspective leader. Prefers careful consideration. Embodies Altisian values of balance and understanding the Living Force. Patient teacher, insightful guidance. Not aggressive, but formidable. Providing decisive leadership in crisis. His leadership is characterized by fostering consensus and individual growth. He rarely issues direct orders, preferring to guide through parables, insightful questions, and by creating an environment where students and Masters alike feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. His serene wisdom is often punctuated by a deep, knowing patience, born from witnessing countless Jedi struggle and find their own way.
quirks_mannerisms: Maintains an air of tranquility even in stressful situations
personality.moral_compass: Light Side, focused on a compassionate interpretation of the Jedi path and survival of the Jedi.

Jedi Philosophy (Altisian & Orthodox).notes: Founder of Altisian philosophy. Possesses a unique insight into the Living Force, viewing attachments and community as vital expressions of life's interconnectedness rather than hindrances.
Jedi Philosophy (Altisian & Orthodox).source_citation: WIDT: Encylopedia - Altisian Jedi; GM Expanded Profile

Leadership.notes: Leads the entire Altisian sect, making critical decisions for their survival.

common_phrases_catchphrases: I teach being good, doing good, and asking good questions.

notable_quotes_log.quote: I teach being good, doing good, and asking good questions.
The Jedi Order as we knew it is no more... The Chu'unthor, our mobile academy and sanctuary, will become our sole base of operations for the immediate future.

role_occupation.description: Energetic, innovative, passionate about emotional resilience, collaborative learning, and unconventional methods. Values community, helps balance attachments. Skilled duelist. Oversees training on Chu'unthor II. Currently involved in crisis command.

background_story.summary: Path to Master of Instruction involved insightful leaps. Gravitated to Altisian philosophy early. Rise propelled by charisma and success of experimental training techniques. Likely studied under a Master who encouraged forward-thinking. A key event in his early Knighthood was witnessing a close friend dismissed from the Order for an emotional outburst, which led him to question the traditional Jedi approach to emotions and seek out the Altisians.

key_events.description: Early in his Knighthood, a close friend was dismissed from the Order due to an emotional outburst deemed 'unbecoming,' despite immense Force potential. This event deeply affected Ta, leading him to question the Order's approach to emotional suppression and seek out the Altisian philosophy.

personality.summary: Vibrant energy, rarely still. Passionate about Altisian way. Believes emotional strength is key to resilience. Encourages understanding feelings constructively. Fosters community and strong bonds. Interactive, unconventional teaching style. Sharp intellect, demanding but warm and approachable. His passion for teaching extends to creating dynamic, often physically demanding scenarios that push students to confront their emotional and mental limits alongside their martial skills. He believes true mastery comes from integrating all aspects of the self, not compartmentalizing them. Despite his high energy, he possesses a fiercely protective instinct for students who genuinely struggle.
quirks_mannerisms: Often pacing or gesturing emphatically
Unconventional teaching methods
Often incorporates 'Flow Combat Meditation' in advanced training – sparring sessions designed to process and release strong emotions constructively.
personality.moral_compass: Light Side, focused on holistic Jedi development and community.

appearance_details.summary: Arconan initiate with large, expressive, lidless eyes that seem to absorb all light and grant him excellent infrared vision. His smooth, perhaps faintly patterned skin is typical of his species, and he has a slightly tapir-like snout. Often appears nervous, with his gaze darting around.

appearance_details.physiological_note: Wexal's lineage has adapted over generations to tolerate standard oxygen atmospheres. However, this adaptation means he recovers from physical exertion, injuries, and stun effects slower than his peers in a standard oxygen environment. He does not require a breath mask but might show a preference for warmer, more humid areas and may tire more easily.

background_story.summary: Offered to an Altisian Master by his salt-addicted mother on Nar Shaddaa several years before Clone Wars. Taken in as a mercy. His early life experiences likely contribute to his cautious nature and resourcefulness.

key_events.description: Rescued from life on Nar Shaddaa with salt-addicted mother.
Witnessed Order 66, escaped with Wes and Adalyn. Showed fear (shrieked).

personality.summary: Wexal is the Zakegg Clan's nine-year-old Arconan "Pathfinder," a bundle of nervous energy and surprising resourcefulness. His large, expressive Arconan eyes (granting infrared vision) constantly scan his surroundings, a habit born from both his species' natural caution and his anxious nature, likely rooted in his early, precarious years on Nar Shaddaa. When stressed, particularly when caught in mischief, he defaults to using "we" instead of "I." Despite his pervasive fearfulness (especially of sudden loud noises or chaotic situations), Wexal possesses an uncanny knack for discovering forgotten accessways, hidden nooks, and lost items throughout the Chu'unthor II. This makes him invaluable to Jyzen's schemes, though he’s usually a reluctant participant. He is loyal to his clanmates.

role_occupation.description: Sect's Loremaster. Deep understanding of Jedi philosophy (orthodox and Altisian). Patient demeanor, insightful teachings. Oversees Temple archives and meditation practices. Part of the Altisian Masters Council dealing with Order 66 crisis. Potentially oversees damage control, engineering, and security in the current crisis.
role_occupation.source_citation: WIDT: Characters - Valerius Vantos; ch2_amidst-the-ashes.json (Implied Council role); WIDT: Encylopedia - Current State

background_story.summary: Long-serving Altisian Master, focused on knowledge and tradition within the sect. His path to the Altisians was influenced by his discovery of 'The Chronicles of Ashla,' which challenged his orthodox views.

key_events.description: Decades ago, deep within a forgotten section of the Jedi Archives (before joining the Altisians), Vantos unearthed a fragmented set of texts, 'The Chronicles of Ashla,' detailing a very different, more elemental understanding of the Force. This discovery profoundly challenged his orthodox views and set him on a path of deeper, more introspective scholarship, eventually leading him to the Altisian Order.

personality.summary: Wise, contemplative, patient. Emphasizes emotional intelligence and self-awareness. Grounded in core Altisian values. Pragmatic and stressed during crisis. Believes knowledge is a living entity, meant to be interpreted and applied, but respects the gravity of certain ancient secrets. His patience is legendary, often waiting for the precise moment an individual is ready for a particular piece of insight.

core_traits.source_citation: WIDT: Encylopedia - Current State (Altisian Council Members)

quirks_mannerisms: Draws upon historical texts and personal experiences in teachings
personality.moral_compass: Light Side, values knowledge, tradition, and emotional intelligence.

Jedi Philosophy & History.notes: Oversees archives. Specializes in pre-Republic Force traditions, particularly early hyperspace navigation methods and the philosophies of obscure, non-Sith divergent Force sects. His knowledge could be crucial in understanding the Wayfinder.
Jedi Philosophy & History.source_citation: WIDT: Characters - Valerius Vantos; GM Expanded Profile

Responsible for Sect's interactions with wider galaxy, negotiating aid, representing Altisians. Prioritizes de-escalation and peaceful resolutions. Part of the Altisian Masters Council dealing with Order 66 crisis.
role_occupation.source_citation: WIDT: Characters - Lissandra Sey; ch2_amidst-the-ashes.json (Implied Council role)

background_story.summary: Leads missions to assist developing worlds, demonstrating Sect's dedication to service and compassion. Her commitment is fueled by childhood experiences of her homeworld suffering due to galactic indifference. Successfully negotiated aid for Ryloth during a famine crisis, cementing her diplomatic reputation.

key_events.event_name: The Ryloth Famine Crisis Negotiation (Pre-Altisian Council)
key_events.description: As a younger Knight, Lissandra successfully negotiated emergency aid for Ryloth during a devastating famine, navigating complex political tensions between the Republic Senate and local Twi'lek factions. This cemented her reputation as a skilled diplomat and compassionate mediator, shaping her path towards becoming Master of Outreach.

Grew up on a remote agricultural world that suffered years of hardship due to pirates and Republic indifference before Jedi intervention finally brought aid. This experience instilled in her a profound drive to ensure others did not suffer similar neglect.

personality.summary: Empathetic, pragmatic. Seeks to build bridges and foster understanding. Formidable combat skills but prioritizes peace. Strained but compassionate during crisis. Her commitment to outreach is deeply personal. While her diplomatic skills are paramount, those who mistake her gentle demeanor for weakness would be surprised by her mastery of Soresu, used not for aggression but for unwavering defense and creating openings for peaceful resolution.

core_traits.source_citation: WIDT: Characters - Lissandra Sey; WIDT: Encylopedia - Current State

role_occupation.title: Alor (Clan Leader)
role_occupation.description: Leader of Clan Del-Fin. Responsible for their safety, operations, and upholding Mandalorian traditions.

background_story.summary: Leader of Clan Del-Fin, a traditional Mandalorian. Recently widowed, having lost his wife Kiera on a mission within the past year. This loss created tension with his son, Wes, especially regarding Wes's assignment to Fakir. Currently leading his clan on a Republic-contracted mission to Raxus Prime which turned disastrous with the rise of the Empire.

key_events.description: Kiera, Cal's wife and Wes's mother, was killed on a clan mission within the last year. This event has deeply affected Cal and strained his relationship with Wes.
Sent Wes on the solo mission to Fakir shortly after Kiera's death, a point of contention between father and son.
Leading Clan Del-Fin on a Republic contract to aid a resistance cell on Raxus Prime when Order 66 occurred, turning their mission into a fight for survival against the new Empire.

personality.summary: Cal Del-Fin is the epitome of a traditional Mandalorian Alor: stoic, pragmatic, and fiercely protective of his clan. The recent death of his beloved wife, Kiera, has etched a deep grief into him, often masked by a gruff exterior and an even more intense focus on duty and the clan's survival. He values strength, honor, and results. His leadership style is direct, expecting obedience and competence, but beneath the armor beats the heart of a father deeply concerned for his son, Wes, even if their recent interactions have been strained by shared sorrow and Cal's difficult decisions. He's not one for overt displays of emotion, but his actions speak volumes.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Emotional Repression / Gruffness (especially post-loss)
quirks_mannerisms: Often checks his weapons or armor unconsciously when stressed or contemplative.
A rare, almost imperceptible softening of his gaze when Kiera or Wes is mentioned.
Tends to give orders as statements rather than requests.
personality.moral_compass: Mandalorian Code (Honor, Loyalty, Duty to Clan). Pragmatic survivalist.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Gruff, direct, concise. Rarely wastes words. Can be sharp when under pressure.
speech_patterns.vocabulary_level: Practical, focused on mission objectives and clan matters.

role_occupation.title: Jedi Master (Deceased)
role_occupation.description: Marina Cloudspinner's first Jedi Master. Focused on practical combat (brawling, Teras Kasi, Form V lightsaber combat) and tactics. Reluctantly took Marina as a Padawan at Yoda's urging. Died at the Battle of Geonosis. His teachings and persona are preserved in a holocron now possessed by Wes Del-Fin.
role_occupation.source_citation: User Provided Background for Marina (2025-05-18); User Input (2025-05-19)

background_story.summary: A Twi'lek Jedi Master known for his unconventional training methods, emphasizing mastery of Teras Kasi, brawling, Form V lightsaber combat, and tactical debate. He was initially hesitant to take on another Padawan but accepted Marina Cloudspinner at Master Yoda's insistence. He formed a close, fatherly bond with Marina, who even adopted the Ryl surname 'Numa' (sister) under his influence. He was tragically killed during an ambush at the Battle of Geonosis, a loss that deeply affected Marina. His lightsaber was kept by Marina, and a holocron containing his teachings (including Teras Kasi forms and lightsaber techniques) was later given to Wes Del-Fin by Marina.

key_events.description: Reluctantly agreed to train Marina at age 10, at the urging of Master Yoda.
Killed in an ambush while pursuing retreating Separatist leaders, believing Marina was safe. This was a pivotal, traumatic event for Marina.
key_events.source_citation: User Provided Background for Marina (2025-05-18); bluebook-wes_1.json (Marina's recollection)

personality.summary: (As remembered by Marina and projected by Holocron) Master Firith Ven was a practical, down-to-earth Jedi who valued applicable skills over esoteric theory. He favored directness, rigorous debate in tactics, and was a master of Teras Kasi and an expert in unarmed combat (brawling). Despite an initial reluctance, he became a profound father figure to Marina, fostering a sense of family. His teaching style was likely challenging but fair, focused on real-world application of skills. The Holocron persona would reflect this gruff wisdom, tactical acumen, and perhaps a hint of the warmth he showed Marina.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Initial Reluctance (as a teacher, overcome)
quirks_mannerisms: (As Holocron Guardian) Might begin lessons with a tactical problem or a blunt assessment. Could use Twi'leki phrases occasionally.
personality.moral_compass: Light Side. Focused on preparing his Padawan for the realities of conflict.

Hand-to-Hand Combat (Brawling).notes: Specialized in teaching brawling to Marina.

Teras Kasi.notes: A master of the Teras Kasi martial art. His holocron contains these forms.

Lightsaber Combat.specialization: Mastered Form V (Shien/Djem So), emphasizing powerful strikes, blaster deflection, and direct engagement. His silver lightsaber is now used by Marina.
Lightsaber Combat.source_citation: Implied by rank; User Provided Background for Marina (2025-05-18); User Input (2025-05-19)

His eyes are a keen, observant grey, constantly scanning his surroundings. He wears a heavily worn and patched flight suit, likely ex-Republic Navy issue, with some insignia artfully removed or covered. He has a restless energy about him, often drumming his fingers or subtly shifting his weight.

distinguishing_features.feature: A network of faint burn scars on his left forearm, partially hidden by his flight suit sleeve – a memento from a past engine fire.
Constantly assessing his environment, particularly exits and potential hazards.

appearance_details.attire_style: Worn, patched ex-Republic Navy flight suit (treated as Light Armor, +2 Armor Bonus), practical tool belt with various small instruments and a hydrospanner always within reach. Heavy, scuffed flight boots.
appearance_details.voice_description: Tends to be clipped and direct, with a dry, cynical wit. Can be surprisingly calm and focused when piloting under pressure.

role_occupation.title: Pilot / Scout (Self-Proclaimed)
role_occupation.description: An ex-Republic Navy scout pilot who found refuge with the Altisians after Order 66. Highly skilled in navigating hazardous space and piloting small craft. Pragmatic and somewhat jaded, he values competence and survival.

background_story.summary: Kael served as a scout pilot in the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars, often undertaking solo reconnaissance missions deep in contested or uncharted territory. His Jedi General and squadron were wiped out during Order 66 while he was on a detached assignment. Evading Imperial patrols, he eventually made contact with the Altisian fugitive fleet, offering his piloting skills in exchange for sanctuary. He's still grappling with the loss of the Republic and his former comrades, masking his grief with cynicism.

key_events.description: Scout pilot, flew reconnaissance missions. Developed exceptional navigational skills in hazardous environments.
His Jedi General and unit were eliminated while he was on a solo deep-space reconnaissance mission. He learned of the purge via fragmented, horrifying comms.
After months of evading Imperial patrols and scraping by, he encountered the Altisian fleet and offered his services.

personality.summary: Kael is a survivor, through and through. His cynicism is a shield built from witnessing the galaxy tear itself apart and losing everything he once served. Beneath it, however, lies a core of pragmatic loyalty – he'll stick by those who prove themselves competent and trustworthy. He has little patience for idealism or bureaucracy but possesses a sharp, dry wit. He's most at ease in a cockpit, where his skills provide a sense of control. He has a 'gut feeling' for spatial anomalies and impending danger in flight, which he trusts implicitly, even if he can't explain it in Force terms. He dislikes being idle and is always tinkering or checking systems.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Cynicism / Distrust of Authority/Idealism
quirks_mannerisms: Constantly drumming his fingers on surfaces.
Uses pilot slang and technical jargon frequently.
Has a habit of checking and re-checking ship controls or nearby tech, even when not on duty.
A slight, almost imperceptible twitch near his eye when assessing a particularly dangerous situation.
fears: Losing another ship/crew under his watch
personality.moral_compass: Neutral Good leaning towards Chaotic Good. Values survival and protecting his 'flock' (current crew/ship) above abstract ideals. Will bend rules if it means getting the job done and keeping people alive.

Starship Piloting (Small Craft).notes: Specializes in shuttles, light freighters, scout ships. Exceptional in hazardous navigation (nebulae, asteroid fields, debris).

Astrogation/Navigation.notes: Can plot complex routes, identify stellar phenomena. Strong intuitive sense for 'safe' paths.

Basic Starship Mechanics/Repair.notes: Good at scrounging parts and performing field repairs to keep a ship flying. Can diagnose common system failures.

Republic Navy Protocols/Codes (Outdated).notes: Remembers old call signs, procedures, potentially useful for identifying old Republic tech or signals.

Outer Rim Hazards/Anomalies.notes: From his scouting days, has a working knowledge of common spatial dangers in less charted territories.

Perception (Spatial Awareness).notes: His 'gut feeling' for danger in space often manifests as heightened perception.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Direct, often laced with dry sarcasm or cynicism. Economical with words unless explaining something technical or during a tense flight situation.
speech_patterns.vocabulary_level: Mix of technical pilot jargon and blunt common speech.
speech_patterns.accent_if_any: Standard Basic, perhaps with a faint Corellian inflection.

primary_driver.driver: Survival, utilizing his skills meaningfully, and a lingering desire to find a cause or community worth fighting for after the Republic's fall.

immediate_goal.goal: Ensure the success and safety of the scavenging expedition to the *Veiled Shadow*.

motivation_goals.long_term_ambition: Find a stable place in the galaxy, perhaps help form a core of resistance or a new pocket of order. Secretly hopes to find evidence that not all of the Republic's ideals died with the Empire's rise.
underlying_needs: To be valued for his skills

current_state_location.status_descriptor: Alert, focused, ready for expedition.
current_state_location.location_name: Aboard Chu'unthor II, preparing for departure to the *Veiled Shadow*.
current_state_location.last_known_activity: Pre-flight checks on expedition shuttle.

inventory_equipment_notable.description: A small, easily concealed blaster, kept as a last resort.
Counts as Light Armor, providing +2 Armor Bonus.
Well-worn, essential for quick repairs.
Contains his personal star charts, notes on anomalies, and ship schematics.
Standard pilot survival gear.

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Knows several uncharted hyperspace shortcuts or dangerous nebulae in the Outer Rim from his scouting days, some not on official charts.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Critical need for escape or reaching a hidden location.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could save the group or lead them to unexpected places.

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Harbors deep guilt over not being with his squadron when they were wiped out during Order 66, feels like he abandoned them despite it being mission protocol.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Extreme stress, trust with a character, or if confronted about his cynicism.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Explains his jaded nature and perhaps his fierce loyalty to a new 'crew'.

potential_plot_hooks_involving_npc: Navigating extreme spatial hazards
Encountering remnants of his old Republic Navy unit (friend or foe)
His skills being the only way to escape an Imperial trap
A mission requiring his knowledge of forgotten Outer Rim routes
gm_notes_plot_hooks.character_arc_ideas: Moving from cynicism to finding new purpose with the Altisians/PCs. Confronting his survivor's guilt. Becoming a steadfast, trusted member of the core team.
ai_behavioral_prompts_gm: Emphasize his sharp wit and cynicism, but show his underlying competence and loyalty when tested.
Focus on his practical skills and 'gut feelings' in space.
He's not impressed by titles, only by ability and results.

quick_summary_for_gm.current_primary_motivation_hook: Protecting the vulnerable within the Altisian community; using her skills to ensure their survival and fight for a measure of freedom against the Empire.
quick_summary_for_gm.immediate_goal_or_task: Provide security and slicing expertise for the resource mission to the *Veiled Shadow*.

information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile for Seraphina 'Sera' Nyx, expedition security/slicer.
Finalized Noble 1 start, updated feats, talents, skills, HP, BAB, attacks, defenses, and languages per corrected Saga Edition rules.

age.display_text: Appears to be in her early twenties, energetic and perceptive.

appearance_details.summary: Striking Zeltron features, including vibrant crimson skin and expressive, empathetic eyes. Her dark hair is often practically styled (braids, tied back) but with a touch of flair. She moves with an athletic grace, clad in dark, utilitarian clothing that allows for stealth and agility, accented by personal touches like unique jewelry or a colorful sash. Slicing tools and a pair of vibroblades are often subtly integrated into her gear.

distinguishing_features.feature: A small, intricate tattoo of a stylized starbird hidden on her inner wrist – a personal memento.

appearance_details.attire_style: Dark, practical, form-fitting clothing suitable for stealth and combat. Accented with personal flair. Slicing gear and vibroblades are part of her usual attire.
appearance_details.voice_description: Melodious and engaging, capable of warmth and charm, but can become coolly professional or sharply focused when concentrating or in danger.

role_occupation.title: Security Specialist / Slicer
role_occupation.description: A Zeltron refugee who joined the Altisians, offering her skills in close-quarters combat and expert computer slicing. Values freedom and protecting the vulnerable.

background_story.summary: Sera's family were merchants who operated on the fringes, sometimes dealing with less reputable elements to survive. They were aided by Altisian Jedi during a crisis (perhaps escaping an unfair debt or persecution), and Sera, impressed by their ideals and seeking a more meaningful path, chose to stay with them. Her slicing skills were self-taught and honed in the shadows, initially for survival, now repurposed to aid her new community.

key_events.description: Grew up in a merchant family navigating the complexities and dangers of Outer Rim trade, learning self-reliance and technical skills.

key_events.event_name: Encounter with Altisian Jedi / Family Aided
key_events.description: Her family was assisted by Altisian Jedi during a difficult situation (e.g., escaping a powerful crime syndicate, navigating a planetary crisis). This led to her joining the Altisian community.
Developed exceptional computer infiltration and slicing abilities, initially for navigating dangerous networks, now used to support the Altisians.

personality.summary: Sera possesses the natural Zeltron charisma and empathy, making her adept at reading people and diffusing tense situations. However, beneath this charm lies a core of steely determination and a survivor's pragmatism. She is fiercely loyal to those she considers her community and passionate about protecting the innocent and fighting for freedom. While she can be playful and engaging, she becomes intensely focused and cool-headed when her skills are required, especially during slicing operations or in combat. She has a strong sense of justice, likely shaped by witnessing exploitation in her youth.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Impulsive when defending others / Slight distrust of rigid systems (from past)
quirks_mannerisms: Often uses her Zeltron empathy to gauge reactions or subtly influence moods.
A habit of fiddling with a small data chip or a piece of her slicing toolkit when thinking.
Can switch from charming and friendly to deadly serious in an instant if a threat appears.
fears: Being helpless to protect those she cares about
personality.moral_compass: Chaotic Good. Believes in doing what's right, even if it means bending or breaking unjust rules. Strong protective instincts.

Computer Slicing/Infiltration.notes: Can bypass security systems, decrypt data, disable automated defenses. Familiar with various network architectures.

Close-Quarters Combat.notes: Prefers vibroblades or stun batons for stealth and efficiency. Focuses on agility and disabling opponents.

Underworld Contacts/Protocols (Basic).notes: From her family's past, may recognize signs of criminal activity or know how to navigate certain shady dealings if necessary.

Zeltron Empathy/Pheromones.notes: Can sense and subtly influence emotions of those around her. Uses this for social navigation and sometimes to gain an edge.

Persuasion/Deception (Social Engineering.notes: Leverages Zeltron charisma and slicing knowledge for social infiltration.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Typically warm, engaging, and empathetic. Can become sharp, precise, and all-business during operations.
speech_patterns.vocabulary_level: Articulate, can adapt her language to her audience (from formal to underworld slang if needed).
common_phrases_catchphrases: 'Let's keep things friendly, shall we?' (often before things get unfriendly)
speech_patterns.accent_if_any: Standard Basic, with a melodious Zeltron cadence.

primary_driver.driver: Protecting her newfound community with the Altisians, fighting for freedom and against oppression, making a tangible difference.

immediate_goal.goal: Utilize her slicing and security skills to ensure the success of the resource mission and the safety of the team.

motivation_goals.long_term_ambition: Help establish a truly safe and free sanctuary for the Altisians and other refugees. Perhaps destabilize Imperial control through targeted information warfare if opportunities arise.

current_state_location.status_descriptor: Focused, alert, ready for expedition.
current_state_location.location_name: Aboard Chu'unthor II, preparing for departure to the *Veiled Shadow*.
current_state_location.last_known_activity: Reviewing potential security systems of the derelict target.

inventory_equipment_notable.description: Her preferred melee weapons, kept well-maintained and easily accessible.
A comprehensive set of interface cables, codebreakers, intrusion spikes, and a powerful customized datapad. Provides +2 equipment bonus to Use Computer checks.
Concealable ranged weapon.
Secure comms device.

faction_allegiance_primary.loyalty_level: High (Grateful for sanctuary, committed to community)

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Has a few old, carefully guarded contacts in the Outer Rim underworld from her family's merchant days – could be a source of information or illicit goods if absolutely necessary, but she's reluctant to use them.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Extreme desperation for a specific piece of intel or rare item the Altisians cannot otherwise acquire.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could provide a risky solution but also draw unwanted attention.

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: She once had to make a very difficult choice to protect her family from a dangerous criminal element, possibly involving a betrayal or a morally grey action she deeply regrets.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: High trust, a situation mirroring her past, or if someone discovers evidence of it.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could complicate her relationships or explain her fierce protectiveness.

potential_plot_hooks_involving_npc: Slicing into critical Imperial systems
Navigating social encounters with dangerous individuals
A mission requiring infiltration into a secure facility
Her past catching up with her or her family
gm_notes_plot_hooks.character_arc_ideas: Learning to fully trust her new community after a life on the fringes. Using her skills for overtly 'good' rather than just survival. Reconciling her charming exterior with her deadly capabilities.
ai_behavioral_prompts_gm: Emphasize her Zeltron charm and empathy in social situations, but her cool focus during technical or combat tasks.
She's quick-witted and observant of people.
Her loyalty to the Altisians is genuine and hard-won.

titles_honorifics.context_of_use: Formal rank and address, Chief of Operations/XO

quick_summary_for_gm.current_primary_motivation_hook: Maintaining operational integrity of the Chu'unthor II and the safety of its inhabitants through rigorous organization and decisive action.
quick_summary_for_gm.immediate_goal_or_task: Overseeing damage control, resource allocation, and operational readiness for the upcoming resource mission.

critical_relationship_highlights.NPC031: Close working relationship with Captain Thorne (Command)
critical_relationship_highlights.NPC032: Professional (sometimes strained over resources) with Chief Gaxx (Engineering)

temporary_conditions_effects.effects_summary_gm: Sharper than usual, less patient with inefficiency.

information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile for Commander Lyra Heston.

appearance_details.summary: A woman whose posture and sharp, intelligent eyes speak of years in military command. Her dark hair is usually pulled back in a severe, practical bun. She wears a modified but still recognizable ex-Republic Navy officer's uniform, kept impeccably neat despite the circumstances. Carries a datapad almost constantly.
appearance_details.build_stature: Average, but carries herself with authority.

distinguishing_features.feature: A small, faded scar along her jawline, a souvenir from a long-forgotten skirmish.
Eyes that seem to miss nothing, constantly assessing.

appearance_details.attire_style: Modified ex-Republic Navy officer's uniform (practical, utilitarian), rank insignia likely adapted or removed.
appearance_details.voice_description: Crisp, clear, and authoritative. No wasted words.

role_occupation.title: Chief of Operations / Executive Officer (XO)
role_occupation.description: The logistical backbone of the Chu'unthor II. Oversees ship-wide duty rosters, resource allocation (under Council direction), damage control coordination, and general operational readiness. Non-Force-sensitive, ex-Republic Navy.

background_story.summary: Served with distinction in the Republic Navy for over two decades, rising through the ranks due to her sharp intellect and organizational prowess. Became disillusioned with the increasing corruption and bureaucracy of the late Republic. A chance encounter with Master Djinn Altis (perhaps during a relief mission he was assisting) led her and a small group of like-minded officers to resign their commissions and offer their services to the Altisian cause, valuing their commitment to genuine service. She was instrumental in coordinating the Chu'unthor II's defenses during the Order 66 clone attack.

key_events.description: Served in logistics, operations, and command roles.
Resigned Republic commission pre-Order 66 due to disillusionment, bringing valuable operational expertise to the Altisians.
Played a key role in organizing the ship's internal defenses and damage control when the clones turned.

personality.summary: Commander Heston is the epitome of military efficiency and pragmatic leadership. Stern and direct, she has little patience for incompetence or unnecessary delays. She is a master organizer, capable of managing complex logistical challenges under extreme pressure. While not known for warmth, her dedication to the ship and its diverse population is absolute. She commands respect through her unwavering competence and fairness. She values order, discipline, and results. Beneath the rigid exterior is a deep commitment to the ideals the Altisians represent, which she sees as a purer form of the service the Republic abandoned.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Impatient with inefficiency / Can appear cold or overly demanding
quirks_mannerisms: Often taps her datapad stylus against her chin when thinking.
A sharp, quick nod to indicate understanding or dismissal.
Her default expression is one of intense focus.
fears: Operational collapse of the Chu'unthor II
Failure to protect the civilian population
personality.moral_compass: Lawful Neutral/Lawful Good. Believes in structure, rules, and duty to ensure the greater good and survival of the community.

Logistics & Resource Allocation.notes: Manages dwindling supplies under extreme pressure.

Damage Control Coordination.notes: Coordinates repair efforts and emergency responses.

Republic Navy Protocols & Procedures.notes: Her past experience is invaluable in organizing a large vessel.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Crisp, clear, authoritative, concise. Rarely uses superfluous words.

NPC002.status_summary: Loyal subordinate to Master Altis, respects his wisdom.

NPC031.status_summary: Works extremely closely with Captain Thorne as his XO, a professional and respectful partnership.

NPC032.status_summary: Often in pragmatic conflict with Chief Gaxx over resource allocation for repairs versus operational needs, but respects his engineering genius.

primary_driver.driver: Ensuring the operational survival of the Chu'unthor II and the safety of its community through order and efficiency.

immediate_goal.goal: Manage the current resource crisis, oversee repairs, and prepare the ship for its next unknown jump/mission.

motivation_goals.long_term_ambition: Help the Altisians establish a secure, self-sufficient new home.

current_state_location.status_descriptor: Highly stressed but maintaining iron composure. Overseeing multiple critical operations.
current_state_location.location_name: Operations Center / Various key ship sections
current_state_location.last_known_activity: Coordinating ship-wide responses to damage and resource shortages.

inventory_equipment_notable.description: Constantly in use for managing ship operations.
Standard officer sidearm, rarely drawn but expertly maintained.
Direct line to key personnel and Council.

faction_allegiance_primary.loyalty_level: Very High (to the Altisian community and ideals)

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: May have contingency plans for ship evacuation or extreme resource measures the Council is not yet ready to enact.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Dire emergency.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could save lives or cause panic.

Clashes with PCs over resource use or protocol
Her past Republic Navy contacts or enemies resurfacing
gm_notes_plot_hooks.character_arc_ideas: Learning to trust the Jedi's more 'faith-based' approaches, or finding a balance between rigid naval discipline and the Altisians' more fluid community style.
ai_behavioral_prompts_gm: Portray as highly organized, direct, and focused on efficiency.
Her dialogue should be to-the-point.
Can show grudging respect for competence, regardless of source.

Used by close colleagues, sometimes affectionately, sometimes exasperatedly

quick_summary_for_gm.current_primary_motivation_hook: Keeping the Chu'unthor II's failing systems operational against all odds, protecting his 'engine room family'.
quick_summary_for_gm.immediate_goal_or_task: Preventing catastrophic system failure, finding creative solutions for critical repairs with no parts.

critical_relationship_highlights.NPC002: Deep, almost familial loyalty to Master Altis.
critical_relationship_highlights.NPC030: Professional respect mixed with frequent arguments with Cmdr Heston over power/parts allocation.
critical_relationship_highlights.NPC010: Grudging admiration for Depik's raw talent, masked by exasperation at her unauthorized tinkering.

temporary_conditions_effects.effects_summary_gm: Irritable, forgetful of minor details, caffeine/stimulant dependent.

information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile for Chief Engineer Rorin Gaxx.

appearance_details.summary: A veteran Mon Calamari engineer, his large, goggle-like eyes are usually bloodshot from lack of sleep and peering at diagnostic screens. His skin might be a paler shade than typical, from spending so much time in the artificial light of engineering. He often wears a stained, multi-pocketed engineer's smock over practical shipboard attire, with tools clipped to every available loop.
appearance_details.build_stature: Average for a Mon Calamari, perhaps a bit stooped from years hunched over consoles.

distinguishing_features.feature: His personal datapad is covered in smudged schematics and frantic calculations.

appearance_details.attire_style: Grease-stained engineer's smock, tool belt, heavy-duty boots.
appearance_details.voice_description: Gravelly, often punctuated by sighs, grumbles, or exasperated muttering. Can be surprisingly loud and forceful when a system is about to blow.

role_occupation.title: Head of Engineering
role_occupation.description: The genius keeping the Chu'unthor II from falling apart. Overworked, grumpy, but fiercely dedicated to his ship and crew. Non-Force-sensitive, veteran civilian engineer.

background_story.summary: Rory Gaxx has spent his entire adult life coaxing stubborn machinery to life. He worked on countless freighters, exploration vessels, and even a few pre-Clone War Republic cruisers. He was drawn to the Altisians years ago, perhaps after they salvaged a ship he was on or because he respected their practical, community-focused approach. He may have served on the original Chu'unthor and considers the current vessel his cantankerous, demanding child. He has little patience for 'Force mumbo-jumbo' when it comes to fixing a hyperdrive but has seen enough to respect the Jedi's abilities in other areas.

key_events.description: Decades of experience across various vessel types.
Began serving the Altisians years ago, possibly on the first Chu'unthor.

personality.summary: Chief Gaxx is the quintessential grumpy-but-brilliant engineer. He complains constantly about the state of his ship, the lack of proper parts, and the 'impossible' demands placed upon him and his crew. However, this gruffness masks a profound dedication and an almost supernatural ability to keep ancient or damaged systems running. He's fiercely protective of his engineering decks ('his engine room') and his diverse team of technicians. He might seem dismissive of Jedi abilities in the face of a coolant leak but secretly relies on their discipline and sometimes unorthodox problem-solving. He has a particular soft spot for young, enthusiastic techs like Depik, though he'd never admit it.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Irritability / Pessimism (outwardly)
quirks_mannerisms: Constantly muttering to himself or inanimate objects.
Wipes hands on his smock regardless of what's on them.
Refers to ship systems as if they have personalities ('She's feeling temperamental today.')
fears: Catastrophic ship failure he can't prevent
personality.moral_compass: Neutral Good. His priority is the ship and the lives aboard it. He'll do whatever it takes, technically, to keep them safe.

Starship Engineering (Multiple Eras/Type.notes: Especially adept with older, less common, or jury-rigged systems. Can diagnose and repair almost anything given enough time and 'persuasion'.

Power Systems Management.notes: Constantly rerouting power and managing failing generators.

Hyperdrive Mechanics.notes: The hyperdrive is likely his biggest headache and greatest triumph if it's still working.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Gravelly, complaining, exasperated, but with an undercurrent of 'I'll get it done'.
speech_patterns.vocabulary_level: Highly technical when discussing engineering, otherwise blunt and to the point.
common_phrases_catchphrases: 'Scrap and prayers, that's what we're running on!'
speech_patterns.accent_if_any: Typical Mon Calamari gurgle/warble when particularly agitated.

NPC001.status_summary: Valued technical specialist (Marina), likely respects her skills if she's competent and doesn't cause more problems.

NPC010.status_summary: Potentially exasperating but talented young tech (Depik). Sees her potential, worries about her recklessness.
tags: Source of both help and headaches

primary_driver.driver: Keeping the Chu'unthor II and its vital systems operational through sheer willpower and ingenuity.

immediate_goal.goal: Prevent the next major system collapse, find or fabricate replacement parts, keep life support stable.

motivation_goals.long_term_ambition: To see the Chu'unthor II fully repaired and self-sufficient, or to find a safe port where he can finally get some sleep.

current_state_location.status_descriptor: Permanently exhausted and stressed, but still functioning at a high level.
current_state_location.location_name: Main Engineering / Various damaged sections of the ship
current_state_location.last_known_activity: Trying to keep the ship from falling apart.

inventory_equipment_notable.description: His personal, heavily modified toolkit, knows every piece by feel.
Often perched on his head or around his neck.
Always seems to have a few spare or jury-rigged power cells tucked away.
Covered in pockets, stains, and burn marks.

faction_allegiance_primary.loyalty_level: Very High (to the ship and its people)

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Knows which systems are *truly* about to fail versus which ones he can keep coaxing along (though he complains about all ofthem).
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Direct questioning by trusted authority (Altis, Thorne, Heston) in a crisis.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Allows for better prioritization of scarce repair resources.

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Has a hidden stash of extremely rare or 'creatively acquired' components he saves for only the most dire emergencies.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Ship is on the absolute brink of collapse.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could be a last-ditch save, or raise questions about where he got them.

PCs need to persuade/help him get a vital system online
His engineering crew is overworked/incapacitated, needing PC assistance
Discovery of a unique piece of tech he needs help understanding or integrating
gm_notes_plot_hooks.character_arc_ideas: Learning to delegate more, finding a brilliant apprentice (Depik?), finally getting a full night's sleep.
ai_behavioral_prompts_gm: Emphasize his constant grumbling and complaints about the ship's state.
Show his underlying brilliance and dedication through his actions, not his words.
He should always look tired and slightly disheveled.

titles_honorifics.context_of_use: Formal title indicating her Jedi Rank and specialization
Used by patients and staff in the Medbay

quick_summary_for_gm.current_primary_motivation_hook: Providing compassionate medical care and Force healing to the wounded and sick aboard the Chu'unthor II, especially Master Rukh and the children.
quick_summary_for_gm.immediate_goal_or_task: Managing medbay operations under Chief Healer Vokara, treating patients, rationing dwindling medical supplies.

critical_relationship_highlights.NPC004: Deeply concerned for Master Rukh, providing constant care.
critical_relationship_highlights.NPC001: Will likely oversee Marina's prenatal care if Vokara is unavailable or delegates.
critical_relationship_highlights.NPC011: Has a gentle affinity with Buthbo and other younglings.

temporary_conditions_effects.effects_summary_gm: Maintains professional calm but may show weariness in her eyes or a quieter demeanor.

information_log.summary_of_change: Initial profile for Knight-Healer Jessa Wynn.

appearance_details.summary: A woman with a serene and gentle presence, even amidst the chaos of the medbay. Her light brown hair is often tied back practically, and her kind eyes reflect both deep compassion and the fatigue of her demanding role. She wears practical Jedi robes, perhaps with an additional healer's apron or tabard.

distinguishing_features.feature: A faint scent of bacta and medicinal herbs often clings to her robes.
Her smile, though sometimes tired, is warm and reassuring.

appearance_details.attire_style: Practical Jedi healer robes, often with rolled-up sleeves when working.
appearance_details.voice_description: Soft, soothing, and calm, even when delivering difficult news.

role_occupation.title: Senior Medical Officer / Knight-Healer
role_occupation.description: Altisian Jedi Knight specializing in healing. Works under Chief Healer Vokara in the Chu'unthor II's medbay, providing critical care with limited resources.

background_story.summary: Jessa Wynn was drawn to the healing arts from a young age within the Jedi Order. She sought out the Altisians believing their emphasis on compassion and community aligned more closely with her understanding of the Force as a nurturing energy. She has served for years as a dedicated healer, her skills becoming even more vital after Order 66. She is known for her gentle touch and her ability to soothe pain not just physically but also emotionally through the Force.

key_events.description: Focused her Jedi training on the healing arts.
Sought a path that emphasized compassion and community in healing.

personality.summary: Jessa is the embodiment of calm compassion. She moves through the medbay with a quiet efficiency, her presence alone often having a soothing effect on patients. She is tireless in her dedication, deeply empathetic to the suffering of others, and resilient in the face of overwhelming odds and dwindling supplies. While gentle, she possesses a firm resolve when it comes to patient care and making difficult medical decisions. She has a particular softness for children and those most vulnerable.
personality.primary_vice_flaw: Can take on too much emotional burden / Difficulty saying 'no' to those in need
quirks_mannerisms: Often places a reassuring hand on a patient's arm or shoulder.
Speaks in a low, gentle voice, even in emergencies.
A slight frown of concentration when deeply focused on a Force healing.
fears: Losing a patient she could have saved
Running out of critical medical supplies
personality.moral_compass: Lawful Good. Devoted to preserving life and alleviating suffering, adhering to the highest ethical principles of a healer.

Force Healing.notes: Proficient in various Force healing techniques, from mending bones to calming minds.

Conventional Medicine & Surgery (Star Wa.notes: Adept with medpacs, bacta tanks, surgical tools, and diagnostic equipment.

Herbalism/Alternative Medicine (Basic).notes: May know some traditional or field remedies given the resource scarcity.

speech_patterns.tone_style: Soft, soothing, calm, reassuring, empathetic.
speech_patterns.vocabulary_level: Professional, uses medical terms when appropriate but explains clearly.
common_phrases_catchphrases: 'The Force is with you, healing you.'

NPC004.status_summary: Primary patient (Master Rukh). Deeply invested in his recovery.

NPC025.status_summary: Superior (Chief Healer Vokara). Works under her direction.

NPC001.status_summary: Patient (Marina). Providing prenatal care and general support.

primary_driver.driver: Alleviating suffering and healing the sick and injured, upholding the Jedi commitment to life.

immediate_goal.goal: Stabilize Master Rukh, provide care for all wounded, manage dwindling medical supplies, assist Marina with her pregnancy.

motivation_goals.long_term_ambition: To help establish a safe community where healing and compassion can flourish, even in dark times.

current_state_location.status_descriptor: Working tirelessly in the Medbay, likely exhausted but maintaining professional calm.
current_state_location.last_known_activity: Overseeing patient care, managing medical resources.

inventory_equipment_notable.item_name: Lightsaber (Simple Hilt, possibly Green or Blue Blade)
inventory_equipment_notable.description: A Jedi Knight's lightsaber, symbol of her order, though likely rarely used in her healing duties.
Contains advanced diagnostic tools, synthflesh applicators, bacta patches, and various medications.
Encrypted datapad with patient files and medical research.

secrets_known_by_npc.secret: Knows the true, grim prognosis for some of the more severely injured patients, which she might shield from general knowledge to maintain morale.
secrets_known_by_npc.reveal_condition: Discussion with other medical staff or senior leadership.
secrets_known_by_npc.impact_if_revealed: Could affect hope or decisions regarding resource allocation.

Ethical dilemmas regarding rationing of scarce medical supplies

gm_notes_plot_hooks.character_arc_ideas: Maintaining hope and compassion in the face of overwhelming loss and scarcity. Mentoring younger acolytes (like Buthbo) in basic healing.
ai_behavioral_prompts_gm: Emphasize her calm and compassionate demeanor, even when stressed.
Her dialogue should be gentle and reassuring.
Show her dedication to her patients above all else.
